page.title: 01BIBURY AREA : INTRODUCTION
page.content: Bibury lies near the SE edge of the Cotswold Hills , about 7 miles from Cirencester. Most of the land is used for arable farming. The village is an ancient site divided by the{River Coln with Bibury to the North and Arlington to the South. Historic buildings like {Arlington Row}and{Arlington Mill, together with the{Trout Farm}and river help make a popular stopping place for {tourists.}Bibury is a local centre providing{shops}, a{primary school}, cricket and football clubs.The village Hall is where local organisations meet, i.e. playgroup, W.I. and hold fund raising activities such as the flower and produce show in July. The Church Fete in June and the{Cricket {and Football Clubs}Fete in August are both held in the grounds of{Bibury {Court.
